article:
Shazam! Fury of the Gods

Shazam! Fury of the Gods is a 2023 American superhero film based on the DC Comics character Shazam. It is a sequel to the 2019 film Shazam! and the 12th film in the DC Extended Universe (DCEU). The movie follows Billy Batson and his foster siblings as they face a new threat from the gods.

# Plot

The film takes place after the events of the first movie, where Billy Batson (played by Zachary Levi) and his foster siblings have saved the world from the evil Dr. Thaddeus Sivana. However, a new threat emerges in the form of the Daughters of Atlas, three powerful goddesses who seek revenge against the mortal world for the theft of the magical powers of the gods. The Daughters, led by Hespera (played by Helen Mirren), Kalypso (played by Lucy Liu), and Anthea (played by Rachel Zegler), possess the power to control the elements and are determined to destroy the world.

As the Daughters wreak havoc on the city, Billy and his siblings must come together to stop them. However, Billy is struggling to balance his superhero life with his personal life, and the pressure of being a hero is taking a toll on him. Meanwhile, his siblings are dealing with their own personal issues, including Freddy's (played by Jack Dylan Grazer) new relationship and Mary's (played by Faithe Herman) desire to fit in at school.

As the battle between the Shazam family and the Daughters of Atlas intensifies, Billy and his siblings must learn to work together and trust each other in order to save the world. Along the way, they discover the truth about the Daughters' past and the reason behind their desire for revenge.

# Cast

* Zachary Levi as Billy Batson / Shazam
* Asher Angel as Billy Batson (young)
* Jack Dylan Grazer as Frederick "Freddy" Freeman
* Adam Brody as Super Hero Freddy
* Faithe Herman as Mary Bromfield
* Meagan Good as Super Hero Mary
* Ian Chen as Eugene Choi
* Ross Butler as Super Hero Eugene
* Jovan Armand as Pedro Pena
* D.J. Cotrona as Super Hero Pedro
* Rachel Zegler as Anthea
* Lucy Liu as Kalypso
* Helen Mirren as Hespera
* Djimon Hounsou as Shazam

# Production

## Development

In April 2019, it was announced that a sequel to Shazam! was in development, with Henry Gayden set to return as writer. In December 2019, it was reported that the sequel would be titled Shazam! Fury of the Gods, and that the story would follow Billy Batson and his siblings as they face a new threat from the gods.

## Pre-production

Pre-production on the film began in May 2020, with Zachary Levi and the rest of the cast set to reprise their roles. In June 2020, it was announced that Helen Mirren and Lucy Liu had joined the cast as the Daughters of Atlas.

## Filming

Principal photography on the film began on May 26, 2021, in Atlanta, Georgia. The film was shot on a budget of $100 million, and the shoot was expected to last for around 80 days.

## Post-production

Post-production on the film began in August 2021, with David F. Sandberg set to return as director. The film's visual effects were handled by the Moving Picture Company, with the company using a combination of practical and CGI effects to bring the Daughters of Atlas to life.

# Music

The film's score was composed by Christophe Beck, who also scored the first Shazam! film. The score was recorded at the Abbey Road Studios in London, with a 90-piece orchestra.

# Marketing

The marketing campaign for the film began in July 2022, with the release of a teaser trailer. The trailer showed Billy Batson and his siblings facing off against the Daughters of Atlas, and it gave fans a glimpse into the film's action-packed sequences.

The full trailer for the film was released in October 2022, and it showed more of the film's humor and heart. The trailer also gave fans a glimpse into the film's emotional moments, including a scene where Billy says goodbye to his foster family.

# Release

## Theatrical

Shazam! Fury of the Gods was released in the United States on March 17, 2023. The film was released in IMAX and 3D formats, and it was also available in Dolby Cinema.

## Home media

The film was released on digital platforms on May 23, 2023, and it was released on Blu-ray and DVD on June 6, 2023. The home media release included a number of bonus features, including deleted scenes and behind-the-scenes footage.

# Reception

## Box office

Shazam! Fury of the Gods grossed $130.5 million worldwide, with $53.5 million of that coming from the United States. The film's opening weekend was lower than expected, but it still managed to debut at number one at the box office.

## Critical response

The film received mixed reviews from critics, with some praising its action sequences and humor, while others found it to be too formulaic and predictable. The film holds a 48% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, based on 220 reviews, with an average rating of 5.2/10.

## Responses from cast and crew

The cast and crew of the film responded to the mixed reviews, with Zachary Levi saying that he was "proud" of the film and that he thought it was "a lot of fun". Director David F. Sandberg also responded to the reviews, saying that he was "happy" with the film and that he thought it was "a great sequel".

## Accolades

The film was nominated for a number of awards, including a Critics' Choice Movie Award for Best Visual Effects.

# Future

A third Shazam! film is currently in development, with Zachary Levi set to reprise his role as Billy Batson. The film is expected to be released in 2025, and it will follow Billy and his siblings as they face a new threat.

# Notes

* Shazam! Fury of the Gods is the 12th film in the DC Extended Universe (DCEU).
* The film's budget was $100 million.
* The film was shot on location in Atlanta, Georgia.
* The film's visual effects were handled by the Moving Picture Company.
* The film's score was composed by Christophe Beck.

# References

*None*
